body_html:
For updated information, I had the exact same problem specified above. Following instructions from @Froskekongen, I was able to edit the CROSSTOOL file only and proceed with the instructions on https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources

There was one exception to the instructions; I had to edit the file twice. There are 2 instances of cxx_flag: "-std=c++11" in the current CROSSTOOL version. I added the line cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED" below each of them as follows:

nano tensorflow/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL
  • search for "cxx_flag"
  • found 2 of them
  • added cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED" after both cxx_flag: "-std=c++11" entries
cat -n third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL |grep D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED
    53    cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED"
   173    cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED"

The line numbers correspond to where I added the current entries.

My layout:

OS: Fedora: Kernel - 4.5.7-202.fc23.x86_64
Compiler: gcc-5.3 (needed to override gcc-4.9 vs gcc-5.3 install check)
CUDA: 7.5
cuDNN: 5.1.3

After adding these lines, then everything ran smoothly from here. I followed the remaining instructions from

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources

body:
For updated information, I had the exact same problem specified above. Following instructions from @Froskekongen, I was able to edit the CROSSTOOL file only and proceed with the instructions on https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources

There was one exception to the instructions; I had to edit the file twice.  There are 2 instances of `cxx_flag: "-std=c++11"` in the current CROSSTOOL version. I added the line `cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED"` below each of them as follows:

---

```
nano tensorflow/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL
```
- search for "cxx_flag"
- found 2 of them
- added `cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED"` after both `cxx_flag: "-std=c++11"` entries

```
cat -n third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL |grep D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED
    53    cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED"
   173    cxx_flag: "-D_MWAITXINTRIN_H_INCLUDED"
```

The line numbers correspond to where I added the current entries.

---

My layout:

OS: Fedora: Kernel - 4.5.7-202.fc23.x86_64
Compiler: gcc-5.3 (needed to override gcc-4.9 vs gcc-5.3 install check)
CUDA: 7.5
cuDNN: 5.1.3

---

After adding these lines, then everything ran smoothly from here. I followed the remaining instructions from

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources
